intro: Hypericum tomentosum var. lusitanicum, commonly known as the hairy St. John's wort, is a perennial shrub native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features upright, branched stems covered in dense, white to grayish-white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. The leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and also covered in soft, pubescent hairs. Its showy yellow flowers, which appear in summer, are composed of five petals and numerous stamens, creating a striking visual effect. This plant thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in rocky or dry soils.
